intro: Oedibasis apiculata subsp. apiculata, commonly known as the desert grasshopper plant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This species is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides food for various herbivorous insects.
